newsitem.title: USA: Wired Ventures launches news service.
newsitem.headline: Wired Ventures launches news service.

text.p: Wired Ventures Inc, publisher of Wired magazine and the HotWired Network site on the World Wide Web, launched a third news outlet today -- an online technology news service called Wired News.
Wired News aims to provide 15 to 20 stories a day on technology and the digital and Internet worlds, according to senior producer Martha Baer.
Wired has deals with Netscape Communications Corp to distribute Wired News through Netscape's In-Box Direct and in December will start distribution through the PointCast Network.
Later, the @Home Network and GeoWorks will become distributors, Wired said.
Wired Ventures will not disclose its investment in the Wired News project, which involves paying a staff of 20 reporters and editors assigned to the news service alone.
The company three weeks ago withdrew an initial public offering that would have funded this and other projects.
Baer said advertising will support much of the project.
Wired News does not plan to charge subscribers.
Initital advertisers include Microsoft Corp, Toyota Motor Co Ltd, NYNEX Corp, Hewlett-Packard Co and Oracle Corp.

"We think there is a niche there, a gap," in how technology is covered, Baer said, which she described as "interpretive pieces and sort of knowledge about how the digital world affects the way we live in different arenas."
Baer said Wired News will take the same analytical approach as Wired magazine does.
"No one is covering it (technology) the way Wired magazine would, but Wired is only a monthly," he said.
She said the most direct competitor would be C/NET's News.Com service. Wired News service can be found at www.wired.com on the Internet.
